text: hello everyone today we'll talk about
the role of cloud-based simulation in
development and testing of robot
applications here are three of the core
benefits we've heard from customers for
using simulation in robotics development
first is the ability to reproduce and
test the exact scenarios that have
triggered unexpected behaviors in the
past including edge cases and unsafe
conditions this is difficult when
testing with physical robots second you
can speed up the clock and run
simulations faster than real time
producing results in a fraction of the
time it would take on physical robots
third you can expand test coverage by
programmatically testing many scenarios
using parameterised and repeatable
simulations AWS Robo maker brings cloud
scale to simulations the technical
benefits include the ability to run
hundreds of concurrent simulations with
the Robo maker batch API fully managed
AWS infrastructure which enables you to
run your simulations consistently and
reliably with by the minute
pay-as-you-go pricing you only pay for
simulations when you're using them you
get the benefits of a managed service
with Ross and gazebo built in which will
free up engineering resources finally
the ease of integration with the breadth
of AWS services enables you to connect
your Ross application and tooling with
services like Amazon Cloud watch logs
and AWS code pipeline here are a few
customers that are using AWS Robo maker
today iRobot runs more than 40 automated
tests for each code commit as part of a
CI CD pipeline this enables them to
improve test coverage while increasing
code release velocity Bastion solutions
runs more than 35 robots in concurrently
running simulation jobs in order to test
inner robot interaction in their robot
fleets
finally taki naka generates map files
from multiple building layouts using
simultaneous localization and mapping in
Robo maker simulation then they can
easily deploy the maps to robots for
autonomous navigation without needing to
operate the robots locally first to
learn more about how your business could
use AWS Robo maker
check out our website at aws.amazon.com
slash robo maker there you'll find links
to our technical blogs that describe
many use cases like automated testing
and fleet simulation finally get
hands-on a troublemaker workshops calm
thanks for watching
